metadata.source: Heinz Helmuth Michael Schmidt: Das Yogaśata : Ein Zeugnis altindischer Medizin, Sanskrit und Tibetisch, Bonn 1978 (Diss.).

body.translated_text: Om, reverence to the all-knowing one,

children.text: kṛtsnasya tantrasya gṛhītadhāmnaś cikitsitād viprasṛtasya dūram /
children.translated_text: Of the entire <s>Tantra</s> holding the abode of healing, spreading far,
Esteemed by skilled physicians, shall be composed a collection of a hundred <s>Yogas</s>.
Examining the causes and symptoms of diseases by the knowledgeable physician,

children.text: nirāmadehasya hi bhaiṣajāni bhavanti yuktāny amṛtopamāni // Yś_2 //
children.translated_text: For the body free of disease, the medicines become appropriate, akin to nectar.
With <s>Chinna</s>, <s>Udbhava</s>, <s>Ambudhara</s>, <s>Dhanvaya</s>, <s>Vāsa</s>, and other rare herbs, difficult to touch, <s>Parpaṭaka</s>, <s>Megha</s>, <s>Kirāta</s>, and bitter ones,
With <s>Mustā</s>, <s>Aṭarūṣaka</s>, and great herbs, the decoction should be drunk in fevers caused by <s>Vāta</s>, <s>Pitta</s>, and <s>Kapha</s>.
Prepared with <s>Kṣudrāmṛta</s>, <s>Nāgara</s>, and <s>Puṣkara</s>, the decoction for removing <s>Kapha</s> and <s>Vāta</s>,
Is recommended for fever with breathlessness, cough, loss of appetite, side pain, and even when caused by the three <s>Doṣas</s>.
Decoction prepared with <s>Āragvadha</s>, <s>Granthika</s>, <s>Mustā</s>, and bitter <s>Harītakī</s>,

children.text: sāme saśūle kaphavātayukte jvare hito dīpanapācanaś ca // Yś_5 //
children.translated_text: Is beneficial in fever with indigestion and pain, associated with <s>Kapha</s> and <s>Vāta</s>, and it enhances digestion and metabolism.
A decoction of <s>Drākṣā</s>, <s>Abhayā</s>, <s>Parpaṭaka</s>, and bitter herbs with <s>Śamyāka</s> fruit should be prepared,
For fever arising from <s>Pitta</s> with delirium, fainting, dizziness, burning sensation, confusion, and thirst.
A decoction of <s>Nidigdhikā</s>, <s>Nāgara</s>, and <s>Kāmṛta</s> mixed with <s>Pippalī</s> should be drunk,
In chronic fever, anorexia, cough, pain, breathlessness, weak digestion, and sinus congestion.
A decoction of <s>Durālabhā</s>, <s>Parpaṭaka</s>, <s>Priyaṅgu</s>, <s>Bhūnimba</s>, <s>Vāsā</s>, and <s>Kaṭurohiṇī</s>,
Should be drunk with sugar, for thirst, blood disorders, fever, and burning sensation.
Decoction of <s>Phalatrika</s>, <s>Dāruniśā</s>, <s>Viśālā</s>, and <s>Mustā</s>, combined with <s>Niśā</s> paste,

children.text: pibet kaṣāyaṃ madhusaṃprayuktaṃ sarvaprameheṣu samutthiteṣu // Yś_9 //
children.translated_text: Should be drunk with honey, in all types of <s>Prameha</s> (diabetes).

children.text: savatsakaḥ sātiviṣaḥ sabilvaḥ sodīcyamustaś ca kṛtaḥ kaṣāyaḥ /
children.translated_text: A decoction made with <s>Savatsaka</s>, <s>Sātiviṣa</s>, <s>Bilva</s>, and <s>Udīcyamusta</s>,

children.text: sāme saśūle ca saśoṇite ca cirapravṛtte 'pi hito 'tisāre // Yś_10 //
children.translated_text: Is beneficial in chronic diarrhea with indigestion, pain, and blood.

children.text: śuṇṭhīṃ samustātiviṣāguḍūcīṃ pibej jalena kvathitāṃ samāṃśām /
children.translated_text: One should drink a decoction of equal parts of <s>Śuṇṭhī</s>, <s>Mustā</s>, <s>Tiviṣā</s>, and <s>Guḍūcī</s> boiled in water,

children.text: mandānalatve satatāmayānām āmānubandhe grahaṇīgade ca // Yś_11 //
children.translated_text: In cases of weak digestion, chronic diseases, and in disorders like <s>Grahaṇī</s> with indigestion.
One should drink <s>Punarnavā</s>, <s>Dārvy</s>, <s>Abhayā</s>, and <s>Guḍūcī</s> combined with cow's urine,
In skin disorders, swelling, abdominal diseases, anemia, obesity, excessive salivation, and upper <s>Kapha</s> disorders.
A decoction of <s>Mustā</s>, <s>Khuparṇī</s>, <s>Phala</s>, <s>Dāru</s>, and <s>Śigru</s>, with <s>Kṛṣṇā</s> and <s>Kṛmiśatru</s> paste,

children.text: mārgadvayenāpi cirapravṛttān kṛmīn nihanyāt kṛmijāṃś ca rogān // Yś_13 //
children.translated_text: Destroys worms and worm-related diseases through both pathways, even if long-established.
With <s>Ela</s>, <s>Pakulyā</s>, <s>Madhuka</s>, <s>Aśmabhedaka</s>, <s>Kauntī</s>, <s>Śvadaṃṣṭrā</s>, <s>Vṛṣa</s>, and <s>Korubūka</s>,

children.text: śṛtaṃ pibed aśmajatupradhānaṃ saśarkare sāśmarimūtrakṛcchre // Yś_14 //
children.translated_text: Boiled and drunk with sugar, primarily for urinary stones and difficulty in urination.
Powders of <s>Ela</s>, <s>Aśmabhedaka</s>, <s>Śilājatu</s>, and <s>Pippalī</s> mixed with rice water are consumed,

children.text: yad vā guḍena sahitāny avalehyamānāny āsannamṛtyur api jīvati mūtrakṛcchrī // Yś_15 //
children.translated_text: Or taken with jaggery, even one near death from urinary issues lives.
A decoction of <s>Harītakī</s>, <s>Gokṣura</s>, <s>Rājavṛkṣa</s>, <s>Pāṣāṇabheda</s>, <s>Dhanvaya</s>, and <s>Vāsaka</s>,

children.text: kvāthaṃ piben mākṣikasaṃprayuktaṃ kṛcchre sadāhe saruje vibandhe // Yś_16 //
children.translated_text: Should be drunk with honey, in urinary troubles, burning, pain, and constipation.
A decoction of <s>Vāsā</s>, <s>Guḍūcī</s>, and <s>Caturaṅgula</s> with <s>Eraṇḍa</s> oil should be drunk,

children.text: krameṇa sarvāṅgajam apy aśeṣaṃ jayed asṛgvātabhavaṃ vikāram // Yś_17 //
children.translated_text: Gradually conquers all systemic disorders arising from blood and <s>Vāta</s>.
A mixture of <s>Rasāñjana</s>, root of <s>Taṇḍulaka</s>, with honey, drunk with rice water,

children.text: asṛgdaraṃ sarvabhavaṃ nihanti śvāsaṃ ca bhārgī saha nāgareṇa // Yś_18 //
children.translated_text: Destroys all bleeding disorders and breathlessness, with <s>Bhārgī</s> and <s>Nāgara</s>.
A decoction made with <s>Eraṇḍa</s>, <s>Bilva</s>, <s>Bṛhatī</s> duo, <s>Ātuluṅga</s>, <s>Pāṣāṇabheda</s>, <s>Trikaṭu</s> root,
Mixed with <s>Kṣāra</s>, <s>Hiṅgu</s>, <s>Lavaṇa</s>, <s>Urhu</s> oil, should be drunk for pain in the loins, hips, heart, and breasts.
With <s>Hiṅgu</s>, <s>Ugragandhā</s>, <s>Aviḍa</s>, <s>Śuṇṭhī</s>, <s>Ajājī</s>, <s>Harītakī</s>, <s>Puṣkara</s> root, and <s>Kuṣṭha</s>,

children.text: bhāgottaraṃ cūrṇitam etad iṣṭaṃ gulmodarājīrṇavisūcikāsu // Yś_20 //
children.translated_text: This powdered mixture is desired in cases of abdominal tumors, indigestion, and sprue.
Powder of equal parts of <s>Rucaka</s>, <s>Hiṅgu</s>, and great herbs, with <s>Śuṇṭhī</s> water, in disorders arising from <s>Kapha</s> and <s>Vāta</s>,

children.text: hṛtpārśvapṛṣṭhajaṭharārtivisūcikāsu peyaṃ tathā yavarasena ca viḍvibandhe // Yś_21 //
children.translated_text: Should be drunk for heart, side, back, and abdominal pains, sprue, and with barley water for constipation.
With <s>Pūtīkapatra</s>, <s>Gajacirbhiṭa</s>, <s>Cavya</s>, <s>Vahni</s> and pungent spices arranged with salt as a base,

children.text: dagdhvā vicūrṇya dadhimastuyutaṃ prayojyaṃ gulmodaraśvayathupāṇḍugudodbhaveṣu // Yś_22 //
children.translated_text: burn, grind, and use with buttermilk for conditions of abdominal tumors, dropsy, anemia, and hemorrhoids.

children.text: dviruttarā hiṅgu vacā sakuṣṭhā suvarcikā ceti viḍaṃ ca cūrṇam /
children.translated_text: Double quantity of <s>Hiṅgu</s>, <s>Vacā</s>, with <s>Kuṣṭha</s>, <s>Suvarcikā</s> and <s>Viḍa</s> as a powder,
to be taken with warm water, effective against bloating, sprue, heart disease, abdominal tumors, and upward-moving <s>Vāta</s>.
With <s>Śṛṅgī</s>, <s>Kaṭutraya</s>, <s>Phalatraya</s>, <s>Kaṇṭakārī</s>, <s>Bhārgī</s>, <s>Puṣkarajaṭā</s> and five salts,

children.text: cūrṇaṃ pibed aśiśireṇa jalena hikkāśvāsordhvavātakasanārucipīnaseṣu // Yś_24 //
children.translated_text: the powder should be drunk with cold water for hiccups, breathlessness, upward-moving <s>Vāta</s>, cough, loss of taste, and nasal congestion.
With <s>Nādeyī</s>, <s>Kuṭaja</s>, <s>Arka</s>, <s>Śigru</s>, <s>Bṛhatī</s>, <s>Snug</s>, <s>Bilva</s>, <s>Bhallātaka</s>-
<s>Vyāghrī</s>, <s>Kiṃśuka</s>, <s>Pāribhadraka</s> roots, <s>Pāmārga</s>, <s>Nīpa</s>, <s>Agnikā</s>,
<s>Vāsā</s>, <s>Muṣka</s>, <s>Kapāṭalā</s> with salt, burnt and the juice prepared,
mixed with <s>Hiṅgu</s> and others, suitable for abdominal tumors, dropsy, and spleen disorders.
With equal parts of <s>Cavya</s>, <s>Amlavetasa</s>, <s>Kaṭutraya</s>, <s>Tittiḍī</s>, <s>Tālī</s>, <s>Ajīraka</s>, <s>Tugā</s>, and <s>Dahana</s>,

children.text: cūrṇaṃ guḍapramṛditaṃ trisugandhiyuktaṃ vaisvaryapīnasakaphāruciṣu praśastam // Yś_26 //
children.translated_text: the powder mixed with jaggery and three aromatics is excellent for hoarseness, nasal congestion, <s>Kapha</s>, and loss of taste.

children.text: tālīsacavyamaricaṃ sadṛśaṃ dviraṃśaṃ mūlaṃ tugāṃ magadhajāṃ triguṇāṃ ca śuṇṭhīm /
children.translated_text: With equal parts of <s>Tālī</s>, <s>Cavya</s>, <s>Marica</s>, double of <s>Tugā</s> root, triple of <s>Śuṇṭhī</s>,

children.text: kṛtvā guḍatriguṇitāṃ guḍikāṃ sugandhāṃ kāsāgnimāndyagudajajvararukṣu dadyāt // Yś_27 //
children.translated_text: make pills with triple jaggery, fragrant, to be given for cough, weak digestion, hemorrhoids, fever, and pain.
With <s>Śuṇṭhī</s>, <s>Kaṇā</s>, <s>Marica</s>, <s>Nāga</s>, <s>Dala</s>, <s>Tvak</s>, and <s>Ela</s>, powdered, increasing sequentially from the last,
should be eaten with sugar for hemorrhoids, weak digestion, abdominal tumors, loss of taste, breathlessness, throat, and heart disorders.
With <s>Sindhūttha</s>, <s>Hiṅgu</s>, <s>Triphala</s>, <s>Yavānī</s>, and pungent spices, mixed with jaggery, make pills,

children.text: tair bhakṣitais tṛptim avāpnuvan na bhuñjīta mandāgnir api prabhūtam // Yś_29 //
children.translated_text: by consuming them, one attains satisfaction and even with weak digestion, should not eat excessively.
With equal parts of <s>Ayas</s>, <s>Tila</s>, <s>Tryūṣaṇa</s>, and <s>Kola</s>, <s>Mākṣika</s> metal powder,

children.text: tair modakaḥ kṣaudrayuto 'nutakraḥ pāṇḍvāmaye dūragate 'pi śastaḥ // Yś_30 //
children.translated_text: with honey, made into a confection, is beneficial in advanced anemia.

children.text: guḍena śuṇṭhīm athavopakulyāṃ pathyātṛtīyām atha dāḍimaṃ ca /
children.translated_text: With jaggery, <s>Śuṇṭhī</s>, or <s>Pakulyā</s>, <s>Pathyā</s> third part, or <s>Dāḍima</s>,

children.text: āmeṣv ajīrṇeṣu gudāmayeṣu varcovibandheṣu ca nityam adyāt // Yś_31 //
children.translated_text: should be eaten regularly in indigestion, hemorrhoids, and constipation.
<s>Harītakī</s>, <s>Nāgara</s>, and <s>Mustā</s> powder with jaggery, should be made into pills,

children.text: nivārayaty āsyavidhāriteyaṃ śvāsaṃ pravṛddhaṃ prabalaṃ ca kāsam // Yś_32 //
children.translated_text: it prevents mouth disorders, severe breathlessness, and strong cough.

children.text: vaṭaprarohaṃ madhu kuṣṭham utpalaṃ salājacūrṇaṃ guḍikāṃ prakalpayet /
children.translated_text: With <s>Vaṭapraroha</s>, honey, <s>Kuṣṭha</s>, <s>Utpala</s>, and <s>Lāja</s> powder, pills should be prepared,

children.text: susaṃhitā sā vadanena dhāritā tṛṣṇāṃ pravṛddhām api hanti satvaram // Yś_33 //
children.translated_text: well-composed, held in the mouth, it quickly alleviates even severe thirst.
Powder of <s>Manaḥśilā</s>, <s>Māgadhi</s>, and <s>Koṣaṇa</s>, combined with sour juice of <s>Kapittha</s>,

children.text: lājaiḥ samāṃśair madhunāvalīḍhaṃ chardiṃ prasaktām asakṛn nihanti // Yś_34 //
children.translated_text: equal parts with <s>Lāja</s>, licked with honey, repeatedly stops persistent vomiting.

children.text: dūrvāraso dāḍimapuṣpajo vā ghrāṇapravṛtte 'sṛji nasyam uktam /
children.translated_text: Juice of <s>Dūrvā</s> or flowers of <s>Dāḍima</s> is recommended as nasal therapy for nasal bleeding,

children.text: stanyena vālaktarasena vāpi viṇ makṣikānāṃ ca nihanti hikkām // Yś_35 //
children.translated_text: with milk or <s>Lakta</s> juice, it also eliminates hiccups.

children.text: dhātrīrasaḥ sarjarasaḥ sapākyaḥ sauvīrapiṣṭaś ca tadāsutaś ca /
children.translated_text: Juice of <s>Dhātrī</s>, <s>Sarjarasa</s> cooked, with <s>Sauvīra</s> paste, and boiled,

children.text: bhavanti sidhmāni yathā na bhūyas tathaivam udvartanakaṃ karoti // Yś_36 //
children.translated_text: becomes a paste that prevents recurrence, thus used as an ointment.
<s>Dūrvā</s>, <s>Abhayā</s>, <s>Saindhava</s>, <s>Cakramarda</s>, <s>Kuṭheraka</s> with fermented gruel paste,

children.text: tribhiḥ pralepair api baddhamūlāṃ dadruṃ ca kaṇḍuṃ ca vināśayanti // Yś_37 //
children.translated_text: with three applications, even deeply rooted ringworm and itching are destroyed.
With <s>Gaṇḍīrika</s>, <s>Citraka</s>, <s>Mārkavārka</s>, <s>Kuṣṭha</s>, tree barks, and salts with urine,
oil is prepared that cures ringworm, leprosy, chronic ulcers, and skin eruptions.
With equal parts of <s>Sindūra</s>, <s>Guggulu</s>, <s>Rasāñjana</s>, <s>Siktha</s>, <s>Tuttha</s>, this pungent oil is well-cooked,

children.text: kacchūṃ sravatpiṭakikām athavāpi śuṣkām abhyañjanena sakṛd uddharati prasahya // Yś_39 //
children.translated_text: eradicates wet or dry scabs and pimples with a single application.
With <s>Suvarcikā</s>, <s>Nāgara</s>, <s>Kuṣṭha</s>, <s>Mūrvā</s>, <s>Lākṣā</s>, <s>Niśā</s>, <s>Lohitayaṣṭikā</s>,

children.text: tailaṃ jvare ṣaḍguṇatakrasiddham abhyañjanāc chītavidāhanut syāt // Yś_40 //
children.translated_text: oil prepared with six times buttermilk, alleviates cold and burning sensation when applied.

children.text: sarpir guḍūcīvṛṣakaṇṭakārīkvāthena kalkena ca siddham etat /
children.translated_text: Ghee prepared with <s>Guḍūcī</s>, <s>Vṛṣakaṇṭakārī</s> decoction and paste,
should be consumed in chronic fever, cough, pain, breathlessness, weak digestion, and <s>Grahaṇī</s> disorder.
With <s>Vṛṣa</s>, <s>Khadira</s>, <s>Paṭola</s> leaves, <s>Nimba</s> bark, <s>Amṛta</s>, <s>Tāmalakī</s> decoction and paste,

children.text: ghṛtam abhinavam etad āśu siddhaṃ jayati visarpamadāśrakuṣṭhagulmān // Yś_42 //
children.translated_text: This fresh ghee, quickly prepared, conquers <s>Visarpa</s>, intoxication, leprosy, and abdominal tumors
Caused by aggravated <s>Doṣas</s> residing in skin, flesh, and blood
<s>Visarpa</s> is a special type of wasting disease affecting the entire body
Intoxication is a disorder arising from alcohol consumption
With water of <s>Amṛtā</s>, <s>Paṭola</s>, <s>Picumarda</s>, <s>Dhāvanī</s>, <s>Triphala</s>, <s>Karañja</s>, and <s>Vṛṣa</s> paste

children.text: ghṛtam uttamaṃ vidhivipakvam ādṛtaḥ prapibann idaṃ jayati kuṣṭham āturaḥ // Yś_44 //
children.translated_text: Drinking this excellently prepared ghee with respect conquers leprosy in the afflicted
Pieces of <s>Kuṣmāṇḍa</s> cooked, steamed, dried, and fried in ghee
Should be placed in the prepared mixture with <s>Marica</s>, <s>Magadhā</s>, <s>Śuṇṭhī</s>, <s>Ajājī</s>, and three aromatics
This paste is beneficial for children, the elderly, those with wind, blood, and emaciation disorders, and women with persistent wounds
And is recommended for thirst, cough, blood disorders, breathlessness, abdominal pain, and vomiting
Boiling urine, sour, and honey with <s>Dantī</s>, <s>Piṇḍītaka</s>, <s>Kṛṣṇā</s>, <s>Aviḍa</s>, <s>Dhūma</s>, and <s>Kuṣṭha</s>

children.text: vartiṃ karāṅguṣṭhanibhāṃ ghṛtāktāṃ gude rujānāhaharīṃ vidadhyāt // Yś_46 //
children.translated_text: Make a suppository the size of a thumb, coated with ghee, for relieving pain and bloating in the anus

children.text: saśarkaraṃ kuṅkumam ājyabhṛṣṭaṃ nasyaṃ vidheyaṃ pavanāsṛgutthe /
children.translated_text: Nasal therapy with sugar and <s>Kuṅkuma</s> fried in ghee should be administered for wind and blood disorders
For pain in the brows, ears, temples, eyes, head, and for diseases that worsen daily
With middle seeds of <s>Pathyā</s> and <s>Dhātrī</s> fruit in parts of three, two, and one, prepare a suppository

children.text: tayāñjayed aśrum atipravṛddham akṣṇor haret kaṣṭam api prakopam // Yś_48 //
children.translated_text: With it, alleviate excessive tearing and remove even severe inflammation from the eyes
With <s>Harītakī</s>, <s>Saindhava</s>, <s>Tārkṣya</s> stone, and <s>Gairika</s> ground with pure water

children.text: bahiṣpralepaṃ nayanasya kuryāt sarvākṣirogopaśamārtham etat // Yś_49 //
children.translated_text: An external application for the eye should be made for the alleviation of all eye diseases
With <s>Saindhava</s>, <s>Lodhra</s> fried in ghee, <s>Sauvīra</s> paste, bound in a white cloth

children.text: āścyotanaṃ tan nayanasya kuryāt sadāhakaṇḍūṃ ca rujaṃ nihanyāt // Yś_50 //
children.translated_text: It should be used for eye irrigation, also eliminating burning, itching, and pain

children.text: hanty arjunaṃ śarkarayābdhipheno naktāndhatāṃ gośakṛtā ca kṛṣṇā /
children.translated_text: It destroys <s>Arjuna</s> with sugar, sea foam, night blindness, and <s>Gośakṛtā</s> with <s>Kṛṣṇā</s>

children.text: rasāñjanaṃ vyoṣayutaṃ ca pillaṃ tāpīsamutthaṃ madhunā ca śukram // Yś_51 //
children.translated_text: With <s>Rasāñjana</s> and pungent spices, the paste cures cataracts and night blindness when mixed with honey
With equal parts of <s>Puṣpākhyatārkṣya</s>, <s>Sasita</s>, sea foam, <s>Śaṅkha</s>, <s>Sindhūttha</s>, <s>Gairika</s>, <s>Śilā</s>, and <s>Marica</s>

children.text: piṣṭais tu mākṣikarasena rasakriyeyaṃ hanty armakācatimirārjunavartmarogān // Yś_52 //
children.translated_text: This paste mixed with <s>Mākṣika</s> juice destroys eye diseases like <s>Arma</s>, <s>Kāca</s>, <s>Timira</s>, and <s>Arjuna</s>
<s>Mustā</s>, <s>Uśīra</s> dust, <s>Yavāsa</s>, <s>Marica</s>, <s>Sindhūdbhava</s>, and <s>Kaṭphala</s>
<s>Dārvī</s>, <s>Tuttha</s>, <s>Śaṅkha</s> foam, <s>Nalada</s>, and <s>Kālānusārī</s> as <s>Āñjana</s>

children.text: tulyaṃ cūrṇitam āyase vinihitaṃ kṣaudrānvitaṃ śasyate
children.translated_text: Equally powdered, placed in iron, mixed with honey, is recommended
For eye disorders, red eyes, cataracts, and <s>Pilla</s> related conditions
<s>Mañjiṣṭhā</s>, <s>Madhuka</s>, <s>Utpala</s>, <s>Odadhi</s>, <s>Kaphatvak</s>, <s>Sevyā</s>, <s>Gorocanā</s>
<s>Māṃsī</s>, <s>Candana</s>, <s>Śaṅkha</s> leaves, <s>Girimṛttā</s>, <s>Lī</s> flowers, and <s>Āñjana</s>

children.text: sarvair eva samāṃśam añjanam idaṃ śastaṃ sadā cakṣuṣaḥ
children.translated_text: All in equal parts, this <s>Āñjana</s> is always beneficial for the eyes
Removes itching, moisture, dirt, tears, blood, pain, <s>Pilla</s>, and cataracts
Decoction of <s>Mustā</s>, <s>Tiviṣa</s>, <s>Indra</s>, <s>Dāru</s>, <s>Kaliṅga</s>, <s>Pāṭhā</s>, and <s>Kaṭurohiṇī</s>

children.text: gomūtrasiddho madhunā ca yuktaḥ peyo galavyādhiṣu sarvajeṣu // Yś_55 //
children.translated_text: Prepared in cow's urine, mixed with honey, should be drunk for all throat diseases

children.text: yavāgrajaṃ tejavatīṃ sapāṭhāṃ rasāñjanaṃ dāruniśāṃ sakṛṣṇām /
children.translated_text: <s>Yavāgraja</s>, <s>Tejavatī</s>, <s>Pāṭhā</s>, <s>Rasāñjana</s>, <s>Dāruniśā</s>, and <s>Kṛṣṇā</s>

children.text: kṣaudreṇa kuryād guṭikāṃ mukhena tāṃ dhārayet sarvagalāmayeṣu // Yś_56 //
children.translated_text: With honey, make pills to be held in the mouth for all throat disorders
Decoction of <s>Dārvī</s>, <s>Guḍūcī</s>, <s>Sumanā</s> sprouts, <s>Drākṣā</s>, <s>Yavāsa</s>, and <s>Triphala</s>

children.text: kṣaudreṇa yuktaḥ kavalagraho 'yaṃ mukhasya pākaṃ śamayaty udīrṇam // Yś_57 //
children.translated_text: Mixed with honey, this gargle alleviates severe mouth inflammation

children.text: kuṣṭhaṃ dārvī lodhram abdaṃ samaṅgā pāṭhā tiktā tejanī pītikā ca /
children.translated_text: <s>Kuṣṭha</s>, <s>Dārvī</s>, <s>Lodhra</s>, <s>Abda</s>, <s>Samaṅgā</s>, <s>Pāṭhā</s>, <s>Tiktā</s>, <s>Tejanī</s>, and <s>Pītikā</s>

children.text: cūrṇaṃ śastaṃ gharṣaṇaṃ tad dvijānāṃ raktasrāvaṃ hanti kaṇḍūrujaṃ ca // Yś_58 //
children.translated_text: This powder is excellent for rubbing and stops bleeding and itching in the teeth
With the juices of <s>Sauvīra</s>, <s>Śukta</s>, <s>Ardraka</s>, <s>Mātuluṅga</s>, and <s>Guggulu</s> and <s>Saindhava</s>

children.text: paktvā tu tailaṃ kaṭukaṃ niṣiñcet tat karṇayoḥ karṇarujopaśāntyai // Yś_59 //
children.translated_text: Cook to make pungent oil to be poured in the ears for earache relief
<s>Vāsā</s>, <s>Nimba</s>, <s>Paṭola</s>, <s>Parpaṭa</s> fruits, <s>Śrīcavya</s>, <s>Dārvī</s>, and <s>Ambuda</s>
<s>Tiktośira</s>, <s>Durālabhā</s>, <s>Trikaṭuka</s>, <s>Trāyantika</s>, and <s>Candana</s>
Prepared ghee is recommended for disorders above the collarbone, nasal, eye pain, etc.
And for skin disorders, fever, abscesses, ulcers, pain, and cataracts
<s>Dārvī</s>, <s>Parpaṭa</s>, <s>Nimba</s>, <s>Vatsaka</s>, <s>Kaṇāduḥsparśa</s>, <s>Yaṣṭīvṛṣā</s>
Trāyantī, Triphalā, Paṭola, Kaṭukā, Bhūnimba, and Raktāmbuda,

children.text: eṣāṃ kalkakaṣāyasādhitam idaṃ sarpiḥ praśastaṃ dṛśaḥ
children.translated_text: This ghee prepared with their paste and decoction is excellent for vision,
In disorders caused by Pitta and blood, cataracts, and diseases above the neck.

children.text: śuklairaṇḍān mūlam athogrā śatapuṣpā puṣpodbhūtaṃ yac ca bṛhatyās tagaraṃ ca /
children.translated_text: The root of white castor, fierce Śatapuṣpā, that which is the flower of Bṛhatī, and Tagara,

children.text: tailaṃ siddhaṃ taiḥ sapayaskais timiraghnaṃ nasyaṃ śreṣṭhaṃ vyādhiṣu cordhveṣv apareṣu // Yś_62 //
children.translated_text: Oil prepared with these and milk, removes cataracts, is the best nasal treatment for upper diseases.
In the decoction of Muṣkaka ash, burnt by a flame, immerse the conch shell,

children.text: tat tenaiva punar jalena vipacet kṣāraṃ sa taile vidhiḥ /
children.translated_text: Then again boil it in the same water to make an alkali, this is the method in oil,

children.text: yuñjyāt tad vraṇaduṣṭiṣu vraṇarujāsv arśassu nāḍīṣu ca
children.translated_text: Use it in ulcer infections, ulcer pains, hemorrhoids, and fistulas,

children.text: tvagdoṣeṣu bhagaṃdareṣu vividhe kaṇṭhāmaye ca sthire // Yś_63 //
children.translated_text: In skin disorders, anal fissures, various throat diseases, and persistent conditions.
With Niśā, Yaṣṭī, Madhuka, Padma, Utpala, Priyaṅgu, Kāsāvara, Lodhra, and Candana,

children.text: vipācya tailaṃ payasā prayojayet kṣateṣu saṃropaṇadāhanāśanam // Yś_64 //
children.translated_text: Cooked in oil with milk, it should be used for healing wounds and eliminating burning.
With Jātī, Nimba, Paṭola leaves, Kaṭukā, Dārvī, Niśā, Sārivā,
Mañjiṣṭhā, Abhayā, Siktha, Tuttha, Madhuka, and Naktāhva seeds in equal parts,

children.text: sarpiḥ siddham anena sūkṣmavadanā marmāśritāḥ srāvino
children.translated_text: Ghee prepared with this heals deep, painful wounds affecting vital points,

children.text: gambhīrāḥ sarujā vraṇāḥ sagatikāḥ śudhyanti rohanti ca // Yś_65 //
children.translated_text: Deep, painful, and infected wounds heal and purify.

children.text: śirīṣapuṣpaṃ svarasena bhāvitaṃ sahasrakṛtvo maricaṃ sitāhvayam /
children.translated_text: Śirīṣa flower, infused with its juice a thousand times, Marica, and Sitāhvaya,

children.text: prayojayed añjanapānanāvanair vimohitānām api sarpadaṃśinām // Yś_66 //
children.translated_text: Should be used as a collyrium, drink, and inhalation for those bitten by snakes, even if unconscious.

children.text: mayūrapittena tu taṇḍulīyakaṃ kākāṇḍayuktaṃ prapibed analpam /
children.translated_text: With peacock bile, Taṇḍulīyaka mixed with Kākāṇḍa should be drunk in small amounts,

children.text: viṣāṇi saṃstāvarajaṅgamāni sopadravāṇy apy acireṇa hanti // Yś_67 //
children.translated_text: It quickly destroys poisons, both stationary and moving, even with complications.

children.text: tailaṃ tilānāṃ palalaṃ guḍaṃ ca kṣīraṃ tathārkaṃ samam eva pītam /
children.translated_text: Oil of sesame, Palala, Jaggery, and milk with Arka, drunk equally,

children.text: ālarkam ugraṃ viṣam āśu hanti sadyodbhavaṃ vāyur ivābhravṛndam // Yś_68 //
children.translated_text: Quickly destroys fierce poison like Ālarka, just as wind disperses clouds.
Smoke from the house, with Mahiṣākṣa, Vājigandha, and ghee with Taṇḍulīyaka,

children.text: gomūtrapiṣṭo hy agado nihanti viṣāṇi saṃsthāvarajaṅgamāni // Yś_69 //
children.translated_text: Ground with cow's urine, is an antidote that destroys poisons, both stationary and moving.
With Māṃsī, Sevyā, Lakauntī, Jalajalada, Śilārocanā, Padma, and Keśī,
Sprikka, Caṇḍāharidrā, Agada, Sitapali, Asṛglatā, Padma, and Kailā,
Equal parts, eight of white, four of flowers, are universally consumable,
Destroying spells, misfortune, Piśāca, fever, and poison, known as Candrodaya.
Siddhārtha, Triphalā, Śirīṣa, Kaṭabhī, Śvetā, Karañja, Amṛtā,
Mañjiṣṭhā, two of Rajanī, Trikaṭuka, Śyāmā, Vacā, and Hiṅgu,
Prepared with goat's urine, this antidote removes all seizures,
Destroying spells, madness, Piśāca, and Rākṣasa, used in drinks and more.
With Karpāsa, Asthi, Mayūra leaves, Bṛhatī, Nirmālya, and Piṇḍītaka,
Tvagvāṃśī, Vṛṣadaṃśa, Viṭtuṣa, Vacā, Keśāhi, and Nirmocaka,
With Gośṛṅgī, Dvipadanta, Hiṅgu, and Marica, equally, incense is made,
Known to destroy Skanda, madness, Piśāca, Rākṣasa, possession, and fever.
With Trikaṭuka, Dala, Kuṅkuma, Granthika, Kṣāra, Siṃhī, Niśā, Kuṣṭha, Siddhārtha, Yugmāmbu, and Śakrāhvaya,
Sitala, Śuna, Phalatrika, Śīra, Tiktā, Avacā, Tuttha, Yaṣṭī, Balā, Lohitākhyā, Śilā, and Padma,
Dadhi, Tagara, Madhūka essence, Priyāhvā, Viṣākhyā, Viṣātārkṣya, Śaila, with Cavyā and Amarai, made into a paste,

children.text: ghṛtam anavam aśeṣamūtrāmbusiddhaṃ smṛtaṃ bhūtarāvaṃ tu pānena tat syād grahaghnaṃ param // Yś_73 //
children.translated_text: Ghee prepared with all these in urine, remembered as Bhūtarāva, by drinking, becomes the supreme destroyer of seizures.
With Gada, Śuka, Tarupuṣpa, Bījāmbu, Yaṣṭyadrikarṇī, Nikumbha, Agni, and Bilva,
Prepared with equal parts in urine, the ghee is made,

children.text: vidhivinihitam āśu sarvaiḥ kramair yojitaṃ hanti sarvagrahonmādakuṣṭhajvarāṃs tan mahābhūtarāvaṃ smṛtam // Yś_74 //
children.translated_text: Properly prepared and used in all ways, it destroys all seizures, madness, leprosy, and fever, remembered as Mahābhūtarāva.

children.text: dārvī haridrā kuṭajasya bījaṃ siṃhī ca yaṣṭīmadhukaṃ ca tulyam /
children.translated_text: Dārvī, Haridrā, Kuṭaja seed, Siṃhī, and Yaṣṭīmadhuka in equal parts,

children.text: kvāthaḥ śiśoḥ stanyakṛte ca doṣe sarvātisāreṣu ca sarvajeṣu // Yś_75 //
children.translated_text: The decoction is for children, for disorders related to milk, in all diarrhea, and in all conditions.

children.text: bilvaṃ ca puṣpāṇi ca dhātakīnāṃ jalaṃ salodhraṃ gajapippalī ca /
children.translated_text: Bilva and flowers of <s>Dhātakī</s>, water with <s>Lodhra</s>, and <s>Gajapippalī</s>,

children.text: kvāthāvalehau madhunā vimiśrau bāleṣu yojyāv atisāriteṣu // Yś_76 //
children.translated_text: decoction and paste mixed with honey should be used for children in cases of diarrhea.

children.text: śṛṅgīṃ sakṛṣṇātiviṣāṃ vicūrṇya lehaṃ vidadhyān madhunā śiśūnām /
children.translated_text: Powder <s>Śṛṅgī</s>, <s>Kṛṣṇā</s>, and <s>Tiviṣā</s>, prepare a paste with honey for children,

children.text: kāsajvaracchardibhir arditānāṃ samākṣikāṃ cātiviṣām athaikām // Yś_77 //
children.translated_text: afflicted with cough, fever, and vomiting, and also a single <s>Tiviṣā</s> with honey.
A measure of <s>Dhātrī</s> powder mixed with juice, honey, and ghee in equal parts,
with <s>Kṛṣṇā</s>, <s>Ānī</s>, <s>Sitā</s>, and eight measures, kept on a heap of ashes,

children.text: varṣānte tat samaśnan bhavati vipalito rūpavarṇaprabhāvī
children.translated_text: consumed at the end of the year, enhances appearance, color, and brilliance,
free from disease, endowed with intelligence, memory, eloquence, strength, stability, and vitality.
<s>Yaṣṭī</s>, <s>Tugā</s>, <s>Saindhava</s>, and <s>Pippalī</s> with sugar, used with <s>Triphala</s>,

children.text: āyuḥpradā vṛṣyatamātimedhyā bhavej jarāvyādhivināśanī ca // Yś_79 //
children.translated_text: grants longevity, enhances vigor and intellect, and eliminates aging and diseases.

children.text: cūrṇaṃ śvadaṃṣṭrāmalakāmṛtānāṃ lihet sasarpir madhunā ca yuktam /
children.translated_text: Powder of <s>Śvadaṃṣṭrā</s>, <s>Āmalakī</s>, and <s>Amṛtā</s>, licked with ghee and honey,

children.text: vṛṣyaḥ sthiraḥ śāntavikāraduḥkhaḥ samāśataṃ jīvati kṛṣṇakeśaḥ // Yś_80 //
children.translated_text: promotes vitality, stability, alleviates disorders, lives a hundred years with black hair.

children.text: nimbasya tailaṃ prakṛtistham evaṃ nasyāṃ niṣiktaṃ vidhinā yathāvat /
children.translated_text: Oil of <s>Nimba</s> in its natural state, applied as nasal therapy according to proper method,

children.text: māsena tat kṣīraghṛtopayojyaṃ jarāprabhūtaṃ palitaṃ nihanti // Yś_81 //
children.translated_text: in a month, used with milk and ghee, destroys excessive aging and graying.

children.text: gokṣurakaḥ kṣurakaḥ śatamūlī vānari nāgabalātibalā ca /
children.translated_text: <s>Gokṣura</s>, <s>Kṣura</s>, <s>Śatamūlī</s>, <s>Vānari</s>, <s>Nāgabalā</s>, and <s>Atibalā</s>,

children.text: cūrṇam idaṃ payasā niśi peyaṃ yasya gṛhe pramadāśatam asti // Yś_82 //
children.translated_text: this powder should be drunk with milk at night by one who has a hundred women in the house.

children.text: madhukāṃ madhunā ghṛtena ca pralihan kṣīram anuprayojayet /
children.translated_text: <s>Madhuka</s> with honey and ghee, licking it, should be followed by milk,

children.text: labhate ca na dhātusaṃkṣayaṃ pramadānāṃ ca śataṃ ca gacchati // Yś_83 //
children.translated_text: and does not experience loss of vital fluids and can satisfy a hundred women.
<s>Yaṣṭī</s> decoction with salt, mixed with paste of <s>Kaliṅga</s> and <s>Kṛṣṇāphala</s>,

children.text: sakṣaudram etad vamanaṃ prayojyaṃ ghrāṇāsyakaṇṭhaśravaṇāmayeṣu // Yś_84 //
children.translated_text: with honey, this emetic should be used in nasal, throat, and ear disorders.
A strong decoction of <s>Harītakī</s> with powder of <s>Dantyaṅghri</s> and <s>Kṛṣṇāviḍa</s>,

children.text: virecanaṃ sorubutailam etan niratyayaṃ yojyam athāmayaghnam // Yś_85 //
children.translated_text: this purgative with <s>Surubu</s> oil should be used without fail, for curing diseases.
<s>Rāsnā</s>, <s>Rāṭha</s>, <s>Phalatraya</s>, <s>Amṛtalatā</s>, <s>Pañcamūlī</s>, and <s>Balā</s>,
combined with meat decoction, oil, salt, honey, ghee, and jaggery,
with paste of <s>Puṣpāhvā</s>, <s>Aghanakuṣṭha</s>, <s>Bilva</s>, <s>Phalinī</s>, <s>Kṛṣṇā</s>, and <s>Avacā</s>,
an enema with fermented gruel, milk, and urine is beneficial for <s>Vāta</s> disorders.
Oil prepared with <s>Balā</s> decoction, fragrant ingredients, and matured with curd, husk water, and cream,
similarly prepared with <s>Sahācara</s>, <s>Saraṇya</s>, <s>Amṛtā</s>, and <s>Varī</s>, cooked separately, is an enema that destroys <s>Vāta</s>.

children.text: nasyaṃ vidadhyād guḍanāgaraṃ vā sasaindhavāṃ māgadhikām athovā /
children.translated_text: Nasal therapy should be done with <s>Guḍanāgara</s> or <s>Saindhava</s>, <s>Māgadhi</s> or otherwise,
for disorders of the nose, mouth, neck, shoulders, arms, back, head, eyes, throat, and ears.

children.text: śreṣṭhaḥ parpaṭako jvareṣu vihitas tṛṣṇāsu pañcāmliko
children.translated_text: <s>Parpaṭaka</s> is best prescribed for fevers, <s>Pañcāmlika</s> for thirst,

children.text: lājā cchardiṣu vastijeṣu girijo meheṣu dhātrīrasaḥ /
children.translated_text: <s>Lāja</s> for vomiting, <s>Vastija</s> for urinary diseases, <s>Dhātrī</s> juice for diabetes,

children.text: rāsnā vātagadeṣu mūtram udare plīhāmaye pippalī
children.translated_text: <s>Rāsnā</s> for <s>Vāta</s> disorders, urine for abdominal diseases, <s>Pippalī</s> for spleen disorders,

children.text: saṃdhāne kṛmihā viṣe śukataruḥ śophe tathā gugguluḥ // Yś_89 //
children.translated_text: <s>Saṃdhāna</s> for worms, <s>Śukataru</s> for poison, <s>Guggulu</s> for swelling.

children.text: vṛṣo 'śrapitte kuṭajo 'tisāre bhallātam arśassu gareṣu hema /
children.translated_text: <s>Vṛṣa</s> for blood disorders, <s>Kuṭaja</s> for diarrhea, <s>Bhallātaka</s> for hemorrhoids, <s>Hema</s> for poisons,

children.text: sthūleṣu dāruḥ kṛmiṣu krimighnaṃ harītakī pāṇḍugadeṣu śasyate // Yś_90 //
children.translated_text: <s>Dāru</s> for obesity, <s>Kṛmighna</s> for worms, <s>Harītakī</s> for anemia is recommended.

children.text: akṣyāmayeṣu triphalā vadanti śūleṣu sarveṣu tathā rasonam /
children.translated_text: For eye diseases, <s>Triphala</s> is advised, for all types of pain, <s>Rasona</s> (garlic),

children.text: kuṣṭheṣu nityaṃ khadirasya sāraṃ sarveṣu kāseṣu nidigdhikāṃ ca // Yś_91 //
children.translated_text: for leprosy, always the essence of <s>Khadira</s>, for all coughs, <s>Nidigdhikā</s>.

children.text: śaṃsanti vājīkaraṇe śvadaṃṣṭrām uraḥkṣate nāgabalā balāṃ ca /
children.translated_text: For virility, <s>Śvadaṃṣṭrā</s> is praised, for chest wounds, <s>Nāgabalā</s> and <s>Balā</s>,

children.text: rasāyaneṣv āmalakaṃ sadevagraheṣu rogeṣu śilāhvayaṃ ca // Yś_92 //
children.translated_text: in rejuvenation, <s>Āmalaka</s>, for all planetary afflictions and diseases, <s>Śilāhvaya</s>.

children.text: ity ete vidhivihitāḥ prasiddhayogāḥ siddhyarthaṃ vinigaditā bhiṣagvarāṇām /
children.translated_text: Thus these prescribed renowned formulas are stated for success by the best of physicians,

children.text: dṛṣṭvaitān katham acikitsako 'pi yuñjyād ity arthaṃ punar api vakṣyate 'tra kiṃcit // Yś_93 //
children.translated_text: seeing these, how even a non-physician might use them, is again explained here.
By sustaining, fasting, wakefulness, loud speech, exercise, and with pungent, bitter, astringent, dry (foods),

children.text: cintāvyavāyabhayalaṅghanaśokaśītair vāyuḥ prakopam upayāti ghanāgame ca // Yś_94 //
children.translated_text: worry, sexual activity, fear, fasting, grief, cold, <s>Vāta</s> is aggravated, especially in the rainy season.
kaṭvāmlamadyalavaṇoṣṇavidāhitīkṣṇakrodhānalātapapariśramaśuṣkaśākaiḥ /

children.text: kṣārādyajīrṇaviṣamāśanabhojanaś ca pittaṃ prakopam upayāti ghanātyaye ca // Yś_95 //
children.translated_text: By consuming alkaline substances, indigestion, irregular eating, and food, <s>Pitta</s> is aggravated, particularly at the end of the rainy season
Due to daytime sleep, sweet, cold, fish, meat, heavy, sour, oily, sesame, sugarcane, and milk products,

children.text: snigdhātitṛptilavaṇodakapānabhakṣaiḥ śleṣmā prakopam upayāti tathā vasante // Yś_96 //
children.translated_text: and by consuming oily, overly satisfying, salty, and watery foods, <s>Śleṣma</s> is aggravated, especially in spring

children.text: ity evam ete kramaśo dviśo vā doṣāḥ pravṛddhā yugapat trayo vā /
children.translated_text: Thus, these <s>Doṣas</s> are aggravated sequentially, in pairs, or all three simultaneously,

children.text: kurvanti rogān vividhān śarīre saṃkhyātu saṃjnāvigatān anekān // Yś_97 //
children.translated_text: causing various diseases in the body, numerous and beyond count
Roughness, contraction, pricking pain, dullness, discoloration, body ache, and restricted movement,

children.text: suptatvaśītatvakharatvaśoṣān karmāṇi vāyoḥ pravadanti tajjñāḥ // Yś_98 //
children.translated_text: numbness, coldness, roughness, and dryness are said to be the actions of <s>Vāta</s> by those knowledgeable
Excessive flow, sweating, burning, redness, bad smell, moistness, and improper digestion,

children.text: pralāpamūrchabhramapītabhāvān pittasya karmāṇi vadanti tajjñāḥ // Yś_99 //
children.translated_text: delirium, fainting, dizziness, and yellowish hue are said to be the actions of <s>Pitta</s> by those knowledgeable
Whiteness, coldness, heaviness, itching, oiliness, coating, and stiffness,

children.text: utsekasaṃghātacirakriyāś ca kaphasya karmāṇi vadanti tajjnāḥ // Yś_100 //
children.translated_text: swelling, accumulation, and slowness are said to be the actions of <s>Kapha</s> by those knowledgeable

children.text: etāni liṅgāni ca tatkṛtānāṃ sarvāmayānām api naikanāmnām /
children.translated_text: These are the signs of all diseases caused by them, even those with many names

children.text: kaścid bhavet prāptiviśeṣa eṣāṃ saṃjñāntaraṃ yena tu saṃprayānti // Yś_101 //
children.translated_text: Some specific manifestation of these diseases leads to them being called by different names
Lethargy, drowsiness, impurity of heart, inactivity of <s>Doṣas</s>, absence of hunger and urine,
heaviness in the abdomen, loss of taste, and numbness are cited as symptoms of a disease associated with <s>Āma</s>
Oily, warm, stable, aphrodisiac, strengthening, salty, sweet, sour, oily, and sun exposure,
bathing, oil massage, enemas, meat, wine, rubbing, and kneading,
oleation, sweating, cleansing, calming, oleated poultices and the like
this regimen of diet, lifestyle, and medicine leads to the pacification of <s>Vāta</s>
Bitter, sweet, astringent, cool, breeze, shade, night, fan,
moonlight, cool rooms, mechanical fans, water, clouds, and touch of women,
ghee, milk, purgation, cooling, bloodletting, and applications

children.text: pānāhāravihārabheṣajam idaṃ pittaṃ praśāntiṃ nayet // Yś_104 //
children.translated_text: this regimen of diet, lifestyle, and medicine leads to the pacification of <s>Pitta</s>
Dry, alkaline, astringent, bitter, pungent, exercise, and spitting,
association with women, travel, fighting, wakefulness, water sports, and injuries,
smoking, excessive heat, head cleansing, vomiting, sweating, fasting, and the like

children.text: pānāhāravihārabhaiṣajam idaṃ śleṣmānam ugraṃ jayet // Yś_105 //
children.translated_text: this regimen of diet, lifestyle, and medicine conquers severe <s>Śleṣma</s>
<s>Āma</s> is conquered by fasting, <s>Kola</s> water, light foods, soups, and bitter broths,

children.text: virūkṣaṇasvedanapācanaiś ca saṃśodhanair ūrdhvam adhas tathā ca // Yś_106 //
children.translated_text: with drying, sweating, digestion, and purification, both upwards and downwards
In winter and rainy seasons, <s>Vāta</s>; in water and summer, <s>Pitta</s>

children.text: kaphasya kopaḥ kusumāgame ca kurvanti tad vai vihitaṃ yathaiṣām // Yś_107 //
children.translated_text: and <s>Kapha</s> in spring, are aggravated; thus, this is prescribed for them

children.text: kaphasya kope vamanaṃ sanasyaṃ virecanaṃ pittabhave vikāre /
children.translated_text: In <s>Kapha</s> aggravation, vomiting; in <s>Pitta</s> disorders, purgation,

children.text: vātātmake vastim udāharanti saṃsargaje 'pi vyatimiśram etat // Yś_108 //
children.translated_text: in <s>Vāta</s> disorders, enema is mentioned; this applies to mixed disorders as well
<s>Vāta</s> is pacified by sour, oily, and salty foods; <s>Pitta</s> by sweet, bitter, astringent, and cool foods,

children.text: śleṣmāpi tiktakaṭurūkṣakaṣāyatīkṣṇair āmaṃ praśāntim upayānty apatarpaṇena // Yś_109 //
children.translated_text: <s>Śleṣma</s> by bitter, pungent, dry, astringent, and sharp foods; <s>Āma</s> by undernourishment

children.text: buddhvaitad anyad api yat tad anuktam atra yuktyā svayaṃ samadhigamya yathānurūpam /
children.translated_text: Understanding this, one should also comprehend what is not stated here, using reasoning,

children.text: rogeṣu bheṣajam analpamatir vidadhyāc chāstraṃ hi kiṃcid upadeśalavaṃ karoti // Yś_110 //
children.translated_text: and apply appropriate medicine for diseases with a keen mind, for the scripture provides only a little guidance

children.text: guṇādhikaṃ yogaśataṃ nibadhya prāptaṃ mayā puṇyam anuttaraṃ yat /
children.translated_text: Having composed a hundred <s>Yogas</s> of superior qualities, I have attained the supreme merit

children.text: nānāprakārāmayanīḍabhūtaṃ kṛtsnaṃ jagat tena bhavatv arogam // Yś_111 //
children.translated_text: May the entire world, afflicted with various kinds of diseases, become free from illness through this
